testDescription: This section targets Graphics Interpretation weaknesses and attention management through varied question types requiring complete element identification and constraint tracking.
skillsAssessed: Graphics interpretation with multiple variable relationships
Table analysis with systematic criteria application

dataSources.title: Employee Productivity vs Training Hours by Department
Project Resource Allocation Scenario
dataSources.content: A consulting firm must assign 6 consultants to 3 client projects. Project Alpha requires 2-3 consultants and has a fixed deadline of 8 weeks. Project Beta needs 1-2 consultants with a flexible timeline of 6-10 weeks. Project Gamma requires exactly 2 consultants and must be completed in 12 weeks. Each consultant can work on only one project at a time. Senior consultants (Sarah, Mike, Anna) have 10+ years of experience, while junior consultants (Jake, Lisa, Tom) have 2-4 years of experience. Alpha requires at least 1 senior consultant, Beta requires at least 1 junior consultant, and Gamma has no specific experience requirements.

sources.content: Target audience analysis shows 65% of conversions come from the 25-34 age group, with 58% female and 42% male distribution. Geographic breakdown: 45% urban, 35% suburban, 20% rural. Income distribution: 32% earning $50K-75K, 28% earning $75K-100K, 25% earning $35K-50K, and 15% earning above $100K. Digital Display and Video Streaming show higher engagement in urban areas, while Email Marketing performs better in suburban regions.

questions.questionText: According to the graph, at approximately what training hours per month do Engineering and Sales departments achieve the same productivity index?

options.E: Cannot be determined from the graph

questions.questionText: Based on the productivity patterns shown, which statement can be most accurately inferred about the relationship between training and productivity?

options.A: All departments show continuously increasing productivity with more training
options.B: Engineering department shows diminishing returns after 20 training hours
options.C: HR department achieves higher productivity than Sales at all training levels
options.D: Sales department benefits most from additional training beyond 15 hours
options.E: Training beyond 25 hours decreases productivity for all departments

questions.questionText: Which company experienced the most volatile market share during the period shown, and what was the approximate range of this volatility?

options.A: Alpha Corp with a range of 5 percentage points
options.B: Beta Systems with a range of 6 percentage points
options.C: Gamma Tech with a range of 14 percentage points
options.D: Others with a range of 15 percentage points
options.E: Alpha Corp with a range of 8 percentage points

questions.questionText: If the trend from 2023 to 2024 continues for one more year, which company would be most likely to achieve the largest market share in 2025?

options.E: Cannot be determined without additional data

questions.questionText: For each statement, select True if it can be verified by the table data, False if it contradicts the data, or Cannot be determined if insufficient information is provided.

statements.text: Tech Institute C has the highest graduation rate per research funding dollar.
Universities with lower student-faculty ratios tend to have higher graduation rates.
Research University E has more international students than State University A has total enrollment.

questions.questionText: A purchasing manager needs to select suppliers that meet specific criteria: On-time delivery ≥ 90%, Quality score ≥ 8.5, and Lead time ≤ 12 days. Which suppliers meet ALL these criteria?

options.A: Supplier X and Supplier Y only
options.B: Supplier Y and Supplier W only
options.C: Supplier X, Supplier W, and Supplier V only

questions.questionText: Select the project assignment for Team Composition and the corresponding Timeline that would best utilize consultant expertise while meeting all project requirements.

options.teamComposition: Alpha: Sarah, Mike, Jake; Beta: Anna; Gamma: Lisa, Tom
options.timeline: Alpha: 8 weeks; Beta: 8 weeks; Gamma: 12 weeks

options.teamComposition: Alpha: Sarah, Anna; Beta: Jake, Lisa; Gamma: Mike, Tom
options.timeline: Alpha: 8 weeks; Beta: 6 weeks; Gamma: 12 weeks

options.teamComposition: Alpha: Mike, Jake, Lisa; Beta: Sarah; Gamma: Anna, Tom
options.timeline: Alpha: 8 weeks; Beta: 9 weeks; Gamma: 12 weeks

correctAnswer.teamComposition: Alpha: Mike, Jake, Lisa; Beta: Sarah; Gamma: Anna, Tom
correctAnswer.timeline: Alpha: 8 weeks; Beta: 9 weeks; Gamma: 12 weeks

questions.questionText: Based on the project requirements, what is the minimum number of weeks needed to complete all three projects if they can be worked on simultaneously?
Select the Marketing Channel for the highest efficiency metric and the Audience Segment that shows the strongest alignment with high-performing channels.
If the marketing budget were increased by 50% and allocated proportionally to current spending, what would be the approximate total cost for Social Media and Search Engine channels combined?
Is the average age of employees in Department X greater than 35? (1) The median age of employees in Department X is 38. (2) 60% of employees in Department X are older than 32.

options.A: Statement (1) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (2) alone is not sufficient.
options.B: Statement (2) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (1) alone is not sufficient.
options.C: BOTH statements TOGETHER are sufficient, but NEITHER statement ALONE is sufficient.
options.E: Statements (1) and (2) TOGETHER are NOT sufficient.

questions.questionText: A company's profit margin increased by what percent from Year 1 to Year 2? (1) The company's revenue increased by 20% and costs increased by 15% from Year 1 to Year 2. (2) In Year 1, the profit margin was 8%, and in Year 2, the profit was $2.4 million.

options.A: Statement (1) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (2) alone is not sufficient.
options.B: Statement (2) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (1) alone is not sufficient.
options.C: BOTH statements TOGETHER are sufficient, but NEITHER statement ALONE is sufficient.
options.E: Statements (1) and (2) TOGETHER are NOT sufficient.
